verses.roman:
manaso vṛttayo naḥ syuḥ
kṛṣṇa-pādāmbujāśrayāḥ
vāco 'bhidhāyinīr nāmnāṁ
kāyas tat-prahvaṇādiṣu

synonyms: manasaḥ—of the mind; vṛttayaḥ—activities (thinking, feeling and willing); naḥ—of us; syuḥ—let there be; kṛṣṇa—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; pāda-ambuja—the lotus feet; āśrayāḥ—those sheltered by; vācaḥ—the words; abhidhāyinīḥ—speaking; nāmnām—of His holy names; kāyaḥ—the body; tat—to Him; prahvaṇa-ādiṣu—bowing down to Him, etc.
translation: "May our minds be attached to the lotus feet of your Lord Kṛṣṇa, may our tongues chant His holy names, and may our bodies lie prostrate before Him.
